title.narrative: 3.6 C4D-ADOLESCENTS AGENTS OF CHANGE

description.narrative: 103/006 By 2020, families and communities have strengthened capacity to support the improved and equitable development of adolescent girls and boys and to protect adolescent rights, with a focus on ending harmful social practices and promoting the uptake of new behaviours. Communication for Development (C4D), which contributes to Access To Justice, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Unicef Capacity For Programming On Gender. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2020, adolescent girls and boys in Bangladesh, especially the most disadvantaged, access and utilize high-quality basic social services in a safe and protected environment, and are resilient and empowered as active agents of change.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 103/006 By 2020, families and communities have strengthened capacity to support the improved and equitable development ofadolescent girls and boys and to protect adolescent rights, with a focus on ending harmful social practices and promoting theuptake of new behaviours. C4D

description.narrative: In 2021,;Social and Behavioural Change Communication (SBCC);interventions on adolescent issues focused on ending child marriage and prevention of harmful practices. A ‘C4D Coordination Committee’ was endorsed by the Ministry of Women and Children Affairs signifying a better understanding of the value of C4D, and will enable integration of C4D in Child Rights programming. Over 380,837 people were;engaged,;and 36 unions declared their areas child marriage free.;Multimedia communication on adolescent wellbeing and child marriage (‘Icchedana’, “Raisethebeat4ECM”) reached;over 164 million;and engaged over 87 million people.;; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:23/12/2021

title.narrative: Proportion of caregivers (fathers/male guardians) that can state three benefits of key adolescent issues (parenting skills indicators)(48439), Text
